title: WATCH: Was Matt Phillips lucky to escape red for high tackle on Brahim Diaz?
description: Matt Phillips was shown a yellow card for his high challenge on Brahim Diaz, but should Bobby Madley have shown him a red?
content: Three days after Joe Bennett's tackle ruled Leroy Sane out for six weeks, Manchester City were on the end of two poor challenges in Wednesday's 3-0 win over West Brom.James McClean tried and failed to bring down Kevin De Bruyne in the build-up to City's second goal, while Phillips went dangerously high on Diaz late on.Both challenges brought about yellow cards, while Guardiola found himself questioning fourth official Kevin Friend as to why further punishment was not dished out."I have an opinion. The referees have another one. So they are the bosses, they have to take a decision. I said what I said in terms of the players' protection. I can say it every day, and today we were lucky," Guardiola told Sky Sports."It was good. We can talk and I appreciate Kevin because he came and tried to explain to me his point of view."He does not say, 'Go out', you know? That's why I appreciate it. I did not agree, he knows that, but it's okay, they decide. It is what it is, no problem."
